summary: This document is an email chain from July 6-7, 2020, between a U.S. Pretrial Services officer and an Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding the intake and upcoming arraignment of defendant Ghislaine Maxwell. It includes details about her charges, legal representation, and housing, and coordinates an interview.

persons.name: Natasha Ramesar
persons.context: The U.S. Pretrial Services officer coordinating the intake process and requesting to speak with the AUSA about the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the case, facing charges including conspiracy to entice minors and perjury. Her arraignment and bail hearing are scheduled.

persons.name: Chris Everdell
persons.context: Listed as one of Ghislaine Maxwell's retained defense attorneys.

persons.name: Mark Cohen
persons.context: Listed as one of Ghislaine Maxwell's retained defense attorneys.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: The judge before whom Ghislaine Maxwell's arraignment and bail hearing are scheduled.

connections.description: Chris Everdell is listed as retained defense counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell.
Mark Cohen is listed as retained defense counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell.
Ramesar, as a Pretrial Services officer, is involved in the intake process for defendant Maxwell.

events.title: Maxwell's Arraignment and Bail Hearing
events.description: Scheduled arraignment and bail hearing for Ghislaine Maxwell before Judge Nathan.

events.title: Maxwell's Arrival in SDNY
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell arrived in the Southern District of New York and was expected to be housed at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC).

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested and arrived in the Southern District of New York around July 6, 2020, with plans to house her at the MDC.
Her arraignment and bail hearing were scheduled for July 10, 2020, before Judge Nathan.
The charges against Maxwell included conspiracy to entice minors to travel to engage in illegal sex acts, transportation of a minor, and perjury.
Her retained defense attorneys were listed as Chris Everdell and Mark Cohen.
The email chain shows coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office and U.S. Pretrial Services for Maxwell's intake process.
